intro: Boerhavia atomaria, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, silver-gray leaves and delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is drought-tolerant once established. Its rapid growth and ornamental appeal make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it can be invasive in some areas.
